flashcards.english: Mbogo (buffalo), Huria/Munyi (rhinoceros), Methūka vs Enyūka (crack small vs large), Mīago (leisure), Ikeno (happiness), Mūcang'ang'a (gossip), Mūthīgi (elder's staff), Rūthanju (herding stick), Mūtino (accident-unpredictable), Ūgwati (extreme danger-predictable)
flashcards.notes: Cultural note: Munyi borrowed from Kalenjin/Maasai during Nyeri Kikuyu migration. Mūthīgi vs Rūthanju show status difference. Mūtino (accident) vs Ūgwati (predictable danger) - important distinction

flashcards.english: Kũheane (give away), Gũtanaha (give generously/selflessly), Kũhĩnja/Kũmoca (be thin/lose weight), Kũhana mũnyuko (extremely thin/skeletal), Kwĩhotora/Kwĩharĩria (prepare for action), Makore (husks), Muura (maize pollen/sawdust), Mbaco/Mbogoro (bow legs), Mbegũ (seeds), Mbeũ (selected seeds/youth)
flashcards.notes: Mũndũ muheani (careless giver) vs Mũndũ mũtana (generous person). Mbeũ njĩthĩ = young adults (youth as seeds metaphor)

flashcards.english: Gwĩthirima (spread oil with palms), Kwĩhaka (apply substance with tool), Heho (cold weather), Mbaa (extremely cold with fog), Kĩbii (mist/fog), Kĩnundu (fog), Kũgwata (grasp with both hands/rape/kidnap), Kũnyita (grasp one or both hands), Kũhahũra (scare/shock), Kũmakia (frighten)
flashcards.notes: Gwĩthirima = must use palms, oil only. Kwĩhaka = any tool, any substance. Kĩbii vs Kĩnundu used interchangeably. Kũgwata has serious connotations (kũnyitwo mĩgwate = kidnapped)

flashcards.english: Bacania (drop noisily), Gũithania (drop carelessly), Gĩthayo/Kīgūūta (lazy person), Gocogoco (unnecessary verbal trouble), Ngarari (arguments), Gũkunga (bend to avoid), Gũcema (bend to hide), Gũtherema (spread/increase area), Kũingĩha (increase), Gũthetha (wish ill verbally), Kũroga (cause harm via poison/witchcraft), Gũtirūka (lose footing), Kũhĩngwo (trip on object), Gũtuma (sew), Kũrata (mend/patch)
flashcards.notes: Gũkunga (avoid tree branch) vs Gũcema (stalking/hiding). Gũthetha (verbal curse) vs Kũroga (physical harm). Gũtirūka (general) vs Kũhĩngwo (specific obstacle)

flashcards.english: Complete list of interchangeable words showing dialectal variations and synonyms
flashcards.notes: Examples: Bacania=Gũithania (drop), Mbogo=Munyi (rhino), Canjamũka=Kena (be happy), Gĩthayo=Kĩgũũta (lazy), Heho=Mbaa (cold), Mbeũ njĩthĩ (youth). Shows rich dialectal diversity in Kikuyu
